cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.CC

Reasoning: The problem Scattered Cycles involves finding collections of cycles in a graph that satisfy certain distance constraints, which is a combinatorial problem. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM) or Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. Additionally, the problem involves analyzing the structure of graphs, which suggests that it could also belong to the Computational Geometry (cs.CG) or Graph Theory (cs.GT) sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves kernelization, which is a technique used in parameterized complexity, suggesting that it could also belong to the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category.
